00025 // UnusedVar can suppress gcc warnings about unused variables.
00026 // MustCheckReturn lets a function emit a warning if its return value
00027 // isn't used
00028 #if __GNUC__ >= 3
00029 # define UnusedVar __attribute__((unused))
00030 # define MustUseResult __attribute__((warn_unused_result))
00031 #else
00032 # define UnusedVar
00033 # define MustUseResult
00034 #endif

00036 // This seems to be missing from some systems
00037 #ifndef M_2PI
00038 #define M_2PI 6.28318530717958647693
00039 #endif

00050 template <class num>
00051 inline num max(num a,num b)
00052 {
00053   return((a > b)? a : b);
00054 }
00055 
00056 template <class num>
00057 inline num min(num a,num b)
00058 {
00059   return((a < b)? a : b);
00060 }
00061 
00062 template <class data>
00063 inline void swap(data &a,data &b)
00064 {
00065   data t;
00066   t = a;
00067   a = b;
00068   b = t;
00069 }
00070 #endif

00073 template <class num>
00074 inline num minVar(int n,num* list)
00075 {
00076   num min, a;
00077   min = list[0];
00078   for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
00079     a = list[i];
00080     if(a < min)
00081       min = a;
00082   }
00083   return min;
00084 }
00085 
00087 template <class num>
00088 inline num maxVar(int n,num* list)
00089 {
00090   num max, a;
00091   max = list[0];
00092   for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
00093     a = list[i];
00094     if(a > max)
00095       max = a;
00096   }
00097   return max;
00098 }

00101 #ifndef frand
00102 inline double frand()
00103 {
00104   return ( double(rand())/double(RAND_MAX) );
00105 }
00106 
00107 template <class num>
00108 inline num frand(num minVal,num maxVal)
00109 {
00110   return ( num(rand())/num(RAND_MAX)*(maxVal-minVal) +minVal );
00111 }
00112 #endif

00115 template <class num>
00116 inline num randn(num stdDev = 1.0, num mean = 0.0)
00117 { 
00118   //Uses Box-Muller transform to turn a pair of uniform random numbers into a pair of gaussian random numbers
00119   num u1 = ((num)rand())/((num)RAND_MAX);
00120   num u2 = ((num)rand())/((num)RAND_MAX);
00121   num z1 = sqrt(-2.0*log(u1)) * sin(M_2PI*u2);
00122   //float z2 = sqrt(-2*log(u1)) * cos(2*M_PI*u2);
00123   num x1 = z1 * stdDev + mean;
00124   //float x2 = z2 * std_dev + mean;
00125   return x1;
00126 }
00127 
00129 template <class num>
00130 inline void randn2(num &x1, num &x2)
00131 { 
00132   //Uses Box-Muller transform to turn a pair of uniform random numbers into a pair of gaussian random numbers
00133   num u1 = ((num)rand())/((num)RAND_MAX);
00134   num u2 = ((num)rand())/((num)RAND_MAX);
00135   num r = sqrt(-2.0*log(u1));
00136   x1 = r * sin(M_2PI*u2);
00137   x2 = r * cos(M_2PI*u2);
00138 }

00140 template <class num1,class num2>
00141 inline num1 bound(num1 x,num2 low,num2 high) MustUseResult;
00142 
00143 template <class num1,class num2>
00144 inline num1 bound(num1 x,num2 low,num2 high)
00145 {
00146   if(x < low ) x = low;
00147   if(x > high) x = high;
00148   return(x);
00149 }

00151 template <class num1,class num2>
00152 inline num1 abs_bound(num1 x,num2 range) MustUseResult;
00153 
00154 template <class num1,class num2>
00155 inline num1 abs_bound(num1 x,num2 range)
00156 // bound absolute value x in [-range,range]
00157 {
00158   if(x < -range) x = -range;
00159   if(x >  range) x =  range;
00160   return(x);
00161 }

00166   return((fabs(a) > fabs(b))? a : b);

00170 inline num abs_min(num a,num b)
00171 {
00172   return((fabs(a) < fabs(b))? a : b);

00175 template <class num>
00176 inline num max3(num a,num b,num c)
00177 {
00178   if(a > b){
00179     return((a > c)? a : c);
00180   }else{
00181     return((b > c)? b : c);
00182   }
00183 }

00190   }else{
00191     return((b < c)? b : c);
00192   }
00193 }

00195 template <class num>
00196 inline num max4(num a,num b,num c,num d)
00197 {
00198   num x,y;
00199   x = max(a,b);
00200   y = max(c,d);
00201   return(max(x,y));
00202 }

00205 inline num min4(num a,num b,num c,num d)

00209   y = min(c,d);
00210   return(min(x,y));

00225 template <class data_t>
00226 inline int max_idx(data_t *arr,int num)
00227 {
00228   int mi = 0;
00229   for(int i=1; i<num; i++){
00230     if(arr[i] > arr[mi]) mi = i;
00231   }
00232   return(mi);
00233 }

00235 template <class data_t>
00236 inline int min_idx(data_t *arr,int num)
00237 {
00238   int mi = 0;
00239   for(int i=1; i<num; i++){
00240     if(arr[i] < arr[mi]) mi = i;
00241   }
00242   return(mi);
00243 }

00245 template <class num>
00246 inline void sort(num &a,num &b,num &c)
00247 {
00248   if(a > b) swap(a,b);
00249   if(b > c) swap(b,c);
00250   if(a > b) swap(a,b);
00251 }

00253 template <class num>
00254 inline bool take_min(num &base,num val)
00255 {
00256   if(val < base){
00257     base = val;
00258     return(true);
00259   }else{
00260     return(false);
00261   }
00262 }

00268     base = val;
00269     return(true);
00270   }else{
00271     return(false);
00272   }
00273 }

00317 template <class num>
00318 inline num gcd(num x,num y)
00319 // returns greatest common divisor of x,y
00320 // NOTE: untested
00321 {
00322   int w;
00323   while (y != 0) {
00324     w = x % y;
00325     x = y;
00326     y = w;
00327   }
00328   return x;
00329 }
00330 
00331 template <class num>
00332 num lcm(num x,num y)
00333 // returns least common multiple of x,y
00334 // NOTE: untested
00335 {
00336   num d = gcd(x,y);
00337   num r = (x / d) * (y / d);
00338   // num r = (x * y) / d; // faster but more likely to overflow
00339   return(r);
00340 }
00341 
00342 template <class num>
00343 inline num mod(num x,num m)
00344 // returns x mod m, where x e [0,m-1]
00345 // note this is different from %, which can return negative numbers
00346 {
00347   return(((x % m) + m) % m);
00348 }
00349 
00350 template <class real>
00351 inline real fmodt(real x,real m)
00352 // Does a real modulus the *right* way, using
00353 // truncation instead of round to zero.
00354 {
00355   return(x - floor(x / m)*m);
00356 }
00357 
00358 template <class real>
00359 inline real ramp(real x,real x0,real x1)
00360 // linear ramp from f(x0)=0 to f(x1)=1, with output bounded to [0,1]
00361 // returns f(x)
00362 {
00363   if(x < x0) return(0);
00364   if(x > x1) return(1);
00365   return((x - x0) / (x1 - x0));
00366 }
00367 
00368 template <class real>
00369 inline real ramp(real x, real x0,real y0, real x1,real y1)
00370 // linear ramp from f(x0)=y0 to f(x1)=y1, with output bounded to [y0,y1]
00371 // returns f(x)
00372 {
00373   if(x < x0) return(y0);
00374   if(x > x1) return(y1);
00375   return(y0 + (y1 - y0) * (x - x0) / (x1 - x0));
00376 }
00377 
00378 template <class num,class num2>
00379 inline num bool_sat_count(num cnt,num2 min,num2 max,bool val)
00380 // Saturating counter of a boolean value, clipped to the range
00381 // [min,max].  True values increment the counter (up to max), while
00382 // false values decrement the counter (down to min).
00383 {
00384   if(val){
00385     return((cnt < max)? cnt+1 : max);
00386   }else{
00387     return((cnt > min)? cnt-1 : min);
00388   }
00389 }

00392 //==== Bitwise Utilities =============================================//
00393 
00394 template <class num>
00395 inline bool one_bit_set(num n)
00396 // returns true if num has only one bit set, i.e. n=2^k for some integer k
00397 {
00398   return(n!=0 && ((-n) & n) == n);
00399 }
00400 
00401 template <class num>
00402 inline num num_bits_set(num x)
00403 // returns the number of bits set in x
00404 {
00405   num numBitsSet = 0;
00406   for(num i = 0; i<sizeof(num)*8; i++){
00407     if(x&(1<<i))
00408       numBitsSet++;
00409   }
00410   return numBitsSet;
00411 }
00412 
00413 template <class num1,class num2>
00414 inline bool all_bits_set(num1 x,num2 m)
00415 // returns true if all set bits in <m> are present in <x>
00416 {
00417   return((x & m) == m);
00418 }
00419 
00420 template <class num1,class num2>
00421 inline bool any_bits_set(num1 x,num2 m)
00422 // returns true if any set bits in <m> are present in <x>
00423 {
00424   return((x & m) != 0);
00425 }

00430 template <class real>
00431 inline real angle_mod(real angle) MustUseResult;
00432 
00433 template <class real>
00434 real angle_mod(real angle)
00435 {
00436   angle -= M_2PI * rint(angle / M_2PI);
00437 
00438   return(angle);
00439 }
00440 
00442 template <class real>
00443 inline real angle_long(real angle)
00444 {
00445   if (angle < 0.0) {
00446     return M_2PI + angle;
00447   } else {
00448     return -M_2PI + angle;
00449   }
00450 }
00451 
00453 template <class real>
00454 inline real angle_pos(real angle)
00455 {
00456   return(fmod(angle+M_2PI,M_2PI));
00457 }
00458 
00460 template <class real>
00461 inline real angle_diff(real a,real b)
00462 {
00463   real d;
00464 
00465   d = a - b;
00466   d -= M_2PI * rint(d / M_2PI);
00467 
00468   return(d);
00469 }
00470 
00472 template <class real>
00473 inline real angle_dist(real a,real b)
00474 {
00475   return(fabs(angle_mod(a-b)));
00476 }
00477 
00480 template <class real>
00481 inline real avg_angle(real left,real right)
00482 {
00483   real result;
00484 
00485   if(left < right) left += 2*M_PI;
00486   result = (left + right)/2;
00487   if(result > M_PI) result -= 2*M_PI;
00488 
00489   return(result);
00490 }
00491 
00492 template <class real>
00493 inline real abs_bound_angle(real bound_angle,real tolerance,real a) MustUseResult;
00494 
00498 template <class real>
00499 real abs_bound_angle(real bound_angle,real tolerance,real a)
00500 {
00501   real x = angle_mod(a - bound_angle);
00502   x = abs_bound(x,tolerance);
00503   return(angle_mod(x + bound_angle));
00504 }

00508 template <class data>
00509 int find_item(const data *arr,int num,data key)
00510 {
00511   int i = 0;
00512   while(i<num && !(arr[i]==key)) i++;
00513   return(i);
00514 }
00515 
00516 template <class data,class num>
00517 data *alloc_array(data *arr,num &size,num new_size) MustUseResult;
00518 
00519 template <class data,class num>
00520 data *alloc_array(data *arr,num &size,num new_size)
00521 {
00522   if((arr!=NULL && new_size==size) ||
00523      (arr==NULL && new_size==0)) return(arr);
00524 
00525   delete[](arr);
00526   arr = new data[new_size];
00527   size = (arr != NULL)? new_size : 0;
00528   return(arr);
00529 }
00530 
00531 template <class data,class num>
00532 data *resize_array(data *arr,num &size,num new_size,num cur_used)
00533 {
00534   if((arr!=NULL && new_size==size) ||
00535      (arr==NULL && new_size==0)) return(arr);
00536 
00537   data *narr = new data[new_size];
00538   if(narr){
00539     // copy existing data
00540     for(num i=0; i<cur_used; i++) narr[i] = arr[i];
00541     delete[](arr);
00542     size = new_size;
00543     return(narr);
00544   }else{
00545     // could not resize
00546     return(arr);
00547   }
00548 }
00549 
00550 template <class data,class num>
00551 void free_array(data *&arr,num &size)
00552 {
00553   delete[](arr);
00554   arr = NULL;
00555   size = 0;
00556 }
00557 
00558 template <class data,class num>
00559 data *alloc_array2(data *arr,num &w,num &h,
00560                    int new_w,int new_h) MustUseResult;
00561 
00562 template <class data,class num>
00563 data *alloc_array2(data *arr,num &w,num &h,
00564                    int new_w,int new_h)
00565 {
00566   int size = w * h;
00567   int new_size = new_w * new_h;
00568 
00569   if((arr!=NULL && new_size==size) ||
00570      (arr==NULL && new_size==0)) return(arr);
00571 
00572   delete[](arr);
00573   arr = new data[new_size];
00574   if(arr){
00575     w = new_w;
00576     h = new_h;
00577   }else{
00578     w = h = 0;
00579   }
00580 
00581   return(arr);
00582 }
00583 
00584 template <class data>
00585 void set_range(data *arr,int start,int num,const data &val)
00586 {
00587   num += start;
00588   for(int i=start; i<num; i++) arr[i] = val;
00589 }

00593 template <class data>
00594 inline int mcopy(data *dest,data *src,int num)
00595 {
00596   int i;
00597 
00598   for(i=0; i<num; i++) dest[i] = src[i];
00599 
00600   return(num);
00601 }
00602 
00603 template <class data>
00604 inline data mset(data *dest,data val,int num)
00605 {
00606   int i;
00607 
00608   for(i=0; i<num; i++) dest[i] = val;
00609 
00610   return(val);
00611 }

00613 template <class data>
00614 inline void mzero(data &d)
00615 {
00616   memset(&d,0,sizeof(d));
00617 }
00618 
00619 template <class data>
00620 inline void mzero(data *d,int n)
00621 {
00622   memset(d,0,sizeof(data)*n);
00623 }

00625 #if __GNUC__ >= 3
00626 # define likely(x) __builtin_expect(!!(x),1)
00627 # define unlikely(x) __builtin_expect(!!(x),0)
00628 #else
00629 # define likely(x) (x)
00630 # define unlikely(x) (x)
00631 #endif
